title: Opposition Vetevendosje leads Kosovo poll: preliminary results
text:
Albin Kurti, leader of the Vetevendosje party, casts his vote at a polling station in Pristina, Kosovo, October 6, 2019. REUTERS/Laura Hasani

PRISTINA (Reuters) - Kosovo opposition Vetevendosje party is set to come first in the parliamentary election with 26 percent of votes, slightly ahead of the Democratic League of Kosovo party which won 25 pct of votes, preliminary results showed.

Election Commission results based on 80% of votes counted showed Democratic Party of Kosovo (PDK) coming third with 21.15 percent, while a list headed by the outgoing prime minister, Ramush Haradinaj, won 11.6 percent of votes.
description: Kosovo opposition Vetevendosje party is set to come first in the parliamentary election with 26 percent of votes, slightly ahead of the Democratic League of Kosovo party which won 25 pct of votes, preliminary results showed.
